description:
People can be specified by any ID. 
For example, for a person with an email `slav@encharge.io` use the following query: 

`?people[0][email]=slav@encharge.io`

For multiple people, pass multiple ids in the query like so:

`?people[0][userId]=abc&people[1][userId]=xyz`. 

This will specify people who have userId of `abc` and `xyz`.

Emails, userIds and other IDs can used together in a single query.

id.description:
Encharge ID of the person. An UUID.

At least one of id/userId/email must be specified.

userId.description:
UserID of the person.

At least one of id/userId/email must be specified.

email.description:
Email of the person.

At least one of id/userId/email must be specified.
